Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 13th overall pick, by Northeastern in 1976...
Injured on 6/21/1977 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit (double) on 7/9/1978, off Thomas Tuttle (CBC)...
Earned first career win on 7/9/1978...
Hit first career homerun on 7/29/1982, off Lyndon Williamson (NJ)...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/28/1983, winning 2 games with a 0.64 ERA...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/22/1983, winning 2 games with a 1.29 ERA...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 10/1/1983, going 4-1, 0.82...
Was selected to the 1984 Allstar game...
Won Pitcher of the Month award on 6/1/1985, going 6-0, 1.09...
Was selected to the 1985 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1986 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1987 Allstar game...
Injured on 7/17/1988 with a Spasms Back, out for 3-4 weeks...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Wisconsin on 2/20/1991 to a 2-year deal worth $8,000,000 per year...
